title: Advanced English Proficiency Quiz - Hard Mode
description: This quiz challenges your understanding of advanced English grammar, vocabulary, and idiomatic expressions.
instructions: Read each question or prompt carefully.
Provide the most appropriate and advanced response or correction.
Submit your answers after completing all the questions.

items.question: What is the meaning of 'to hit the nail on the head'?
items.suggestedAnswer: To describe exactly what is causing a situation or problem.

items.question: Complete the sentence: 'Her remarks on the issue were quite ___.'
Fix the sentence: 'Neither of the solutions were effective.'
items.suggestedAnswer: Neither of the solutions was effective.

items.question: Define 'circumlocution'.
items.suggestedAnswer: The use of many words where fewer would do, especially in a deliberate attempt to be vague or evasive.

items.question: Rewrite in active voice: 'A novel was written by her in a month.'
items.suggestedAnswer: She wrote a novel in a month.

items.question: Correct this sentence: 'Whom is going to the store?'
items.suggestedAnswer: Who is going to the store?

items.question: Finish the sentence: 'Despite the criticism, he responded with remarkable ___.'
Explain 'to add insult to injury'.
items.suggestedAnswer: To make a bad situation even worse.

items.question: Identify the error: 'Me and my friends are planning a trip.'
